website_summaries.verdict: This fishing rod rack keeps your rods organized and within easy reach without taking up a lot of space.
pros: Sturdy, freestanding fishing rod rack with a compact footprint
Accommodates fishing rods of all sizes
Easy to take rods in and out
cons: Heavier rods may cause the rack to tip slightly

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Saltwater Offshore fisherman and I had some doubts about the rack based upon a couple of reviews. I'm VERY HAPPY with it and that is why I posted the picture with my review. The majority of my rods are 5'6" with TLD 30 2 speeds and a couple of TLD 50s two speed. I have 2 6' rods with TLD 30s. I was able to store 7 Trolling rods and 3 bottom rods on the 24 rod rack. These are stored in a closet at my condo. I'm going to buy another one for my Spinning rods. Buy one and you won't be sorry!!! Tight Lines
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M.

customer_reviews.title: You’re Kidding, Right?
customer_reviews.text: Ok - this thing is a joke. I thought I was getting a large, sturdy rack to hold up to twelve fishing rods/reels. What I got is some cheap Chinese BS that wouldn’t hold a half dozen ultra light rods. Take a close look at the dimensions on this thing - it’s like two feet in length. All you fools posting up 4-5 star reviews for this thing, should be ashamed of yourselves for the disservice you’re providing for the Amazon buying community. I could have built a better rack with a couple 2x4’s and a dozen drywall screws. C’mon, man!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Mama

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice.  Easy Assembly . Very Happy.
customer_reviews.text: It holds smaller rigs easily, but 12 is a stretch. I put my larger rigs on the sides and swing them out to the edges. I love how it keeps everything organized. Parts fit together perfectly and I assembled in 5 or 10 minutes and I am NOT handy. at all.
customer_reviews.author: Middle Aged Man

customer_reviews.title: Buy it you won't regret it
customer_reviews.text: If you are reading this your search is over. This is is a reliable, well organized and great looking fishing rack. Do yourself a favor get the 24 if you have more than 7 poles because you will probably out grow the 12. The assembly is pretty simple took less than 15 minutes and that included me putting my rods and nets on it. Do yourself a favor and have a leveler handy for the bottom part of the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Likely to purchase another - LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I like this rod rack so much, I'm likely to buy a few more! It's brilliantly engineered, no tools or hardware needed to set up, very stable, should be durable and looks great in my man cave! I've got a large collection of fishing rods and this rack helps keep them organized and safe. It's a much better way to organize and protect expensive fishing rods than by stacking them up in a corner somewhere. The HydraYak video is a review and setup of the KASTKING 24 Rod Rack
customer_reviews.author: Nick Adams Fishing (Hydrayak Outdoors)

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive photos
customer_reviews.text: I consider the photos and video deceptive. The video shows a rod holder that is almost as tall as a grown mans hip. The holder received is barely knee height. Flimsy. Holds SIX rods. Description says ALL rod types AND shows rods with reels attached. Saltwater rod/reel combos are habitually larger than their freshwater counterparts. We are able to store SIX rod/reel combos. The video on product page shows at least four larger racks. The ONE small rack that is barely noticeable is the rack received. Same with photos on product page. Not worth the $50+ price. READ DIMENSIONS CAREFULLY. DO NOT RELY ON VIDEO AND PICS ON PRODUCT PAGE.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Teate

customer_reviews.title: Better screw it together if you want to move it around
customer_reviews.text: Does not stay put-together well if you need to move it around since it just slides together to assemble. Had to drill and machine-screw upright posts on both ends to the base-mounts on both sides. Does not come with casters for ease of rolling it around but I simply hack-sawed the little risers on the corners of the base flush with the rest of the base and then drilled the plastic base and installed casters. Sized adequately for multiple rods since the two sides are far enough apart to accommodate multiple rod/reel combos, both bait-casters and open-face reel types. Unlike other rod racks, this one allows full use of both sides for rod-reel storage/holding without much interference between reels.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for something to to organize my rods and get them out of the corner of the garage. Couldn't stand pulling out several rods to get to one in the middle or back and having to lean them up against the wall and hoping they didn't fall over and get damaged. I went with the 24 Rod Rack so I could put my conventional saltwater rods on it. (You'll need to space them out due to the reel sizes). This sits nicely along the wall of the garage and is out of the way. Lightweight so it can pick it up to get to the back rods if needed. Great price for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny Hebert

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy,,,no customer service
customer_reviews.text: The rack is designed well but nevertheless, a bit flimsy. It does the job and that's about it. One of the main drawbacks is the "protective " caps that go on the legs and uprights do not fit snug and therefore will probably end up falling off and getting lost. I called the manufacturer to discuss this problem but nobody answered the phone???? (Strange) The voice message said to leave a message and someone will call back. Of course they never did... I'd probably never buy or recommend this item to anyone...there are better ones out there I'm sure.
customer_reviews.author: munster

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to assemble- disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: Can’t believe this rack has so many 5 star reviews. I’ve put together ikea furniture with hundreds of pieces and had less trouble. I would’ve chucked the thing back in the box except I knew my husband really wanted it. The end caps are and bar along the bottom are flimsy and slide off the first time you pick the rack up or slide it on the floor. I had to superglue the caps and rails so they would stop falling off. My husband LOVES Kastking products of all kinds but this rack is a major MISS! 2 stars- only because it’s a good looking rack.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Oakes

customer_reviews.title: Handy Size Holder
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty nice rod/reel stand that doesn't take up much space. Not prefect...but nice. I'm able to get 19 rods lined up on it with reels mounted. most of which are baitcasters. If you have a bunch of spinning setups, you'll be able to rack a few more by alternating the reel directions. It would have received a five star rating if the plastic caps actually stayed on without a dab of silicone. It is a nice touch to be able to order this rack without the Kastking sticker on it.
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Defective & a bit smaller than
customer_reviews.text: Defective, maybe used, and a bit smaller than I was thinking. The directions must have been for an older model because they had a significant number of differences from the unit I received. It's not a space ship though & I was able to put it most of the way together before I found a piece glued together incorrectly to make the top bracket and was unable to complete building it. Pay attention to the dimensions as it is for smaller rods/reels. I think it may have been returned at least once before as a washer fell out of a piece when I opened it.
customer_reviews.author: JWeil

customer_reviews.title: The rods are separated.
customer_reviews.text: I like that the unit separates the rods in the cut out areas. Once all rods were in place it was slid out of the walk way of the basement. When sliding the unit the fishing rods started to fall. I secured the rods in place using small bungie cords. One across each row. I'm happy they are separated (not a tangled mess). I'm disappointed that the advertisement is slightly misleading. Also, picking the loaded unit up by the handle is also cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: A quality product for rod organization
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm satisfied with the quality, ease of assembly and it did what it's supposed to do and that is provide a place to organize rods. My garage is now neat and orderly and I have no complaints. Pricey compared to other options but since I currently use KastKing baitrunner reels I thought I'd stick with a brand I'm familiar with and have no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: julian salazar

customer_reviews.title: Really nice sturdy rod rack
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and really sturdy. Other's mentioned plastic end caps coming off when moving the rack. I don't know why you'd try to move it by holding these plastic end caps, nevertheless, if you are worried about it a dab of gorilla glue goes a long way. I was able to get 7 baitcast combos on one side and 8 spinning combos and 2 fly rods on the other side. I think this rack looks nice and will last a lifetime. Really glad to get some space back in my basement.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. As a fisherman and a very handy person, this product is ABSOLUTE garbage. Do not for one second believe that you will want to assemble or put your expensive rods in this trash. I wouldn’t use it for anything. Cut my hand and my finger trying to assemble and I am not incapable of assembling anything that they sell on amazon. This is just junk. Absolute crap. Couldn’t rate lower than 1 Star. Trust me folks....it’s not worth buying
customer_reviews.author: Airgonda

customer_reviews.title: Not for $76. No way. NOT WORTH IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: The review written by Joe Mama sums this thing up well. Are you kidding me? $76 for this piece of garbage? It arrived brand new in the box, each part wrapped in plastic....STLL SCRATCHED UP! Yes, it looks nice, and is easy to assemble. But for $76 it should be larger, and bult way better. I've never seen extruded aluminum that thin. Even the pad printing done on the base to showcase their brand is poorly printed. It's worth $20 maybe $25.
customer_reviews.author: John Dennington

customer_reviews.title: It's lighter than I had imagined but it works great
customer_reviews.text: I expected it to be heavier. It is quite lightweight and I was worried that it wouldn't be sturdy. Once it was fully assembled, the components reinforce each other quite nicely and it feels pretty solid. The rod holding design is well thought out and it holds a great variety of rods. They are very easy to insert and remove. The light weight design also allows me to move it around the garage quite easily.
customer_reviews.author: JudyB

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack...
customer_reviews.text: This rod rack is exactly what I needed and I'm glad I found it! I've got a combination of rods and reels, both spinning and casting, stored in this rack and they fit beautifully. You'll need to alternate reel facing out and reel facing in, in order to fit a larger quantity in the rack, but it's doable. I got the 24 rod item and I'm not sure you could fit a full 24 in the rack, but close to it. Assembly was a breeze and no parts were missing. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: The Answer I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I found this rack and debated over it then bit the bullet and placed the order. I'm so glad I did. This rack is easy to put together and requires no tools. It has a small foot print and holds all my rods and reels and neat and orderly fashion. Now, when I'm going fishing, I don't have my rods scattered all over the garage. They are all in one place where I can easily see what I have and grab what I want for my day on the water. A great product and I'll probably buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Dale E East

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST FOR MY PURPOSES
customer_reviews.text: I'm totally impressed with the looks and function of this holder.. I have eight bass rods and reels and two surfcasting rods and reels and they stand straight and look great in this holder. Five stars no question. Forget that PVC stuff you have to build. It would cost you as much or more just in parts (elbows and t-fittings ain't cheap) and the rods won't stand as straight as they do in this holder.
customer_reviews.author: mickeytwosheds

customer_reviews.title: love it, The only bad thing about it is ...
customer_reviews.text: My rods and reels use to lean in a corner in my basement, not anymore, love it, The only bad thing about it is if you don't have it filled, you're going to want to feel it with new rods
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Under-engineered product. Fell apart first week.
customer_reviews.text: This rod holder was relatively expensive and fell apart the first week I owned it. The glue connecting the supports failed. I reached out to the retailer to try to get them to provide a remedy, but they did not respond. Seller got the manufacturer to send another set of the same glued parts. Not sure how long they will last. My advice is that this product is good for light tackle but not big-game fishing rods.
customer_reviews.author: samantha

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have bought sooner
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the rack in black and it looks great in my garage. Put it together in 5 minutes and it holds my rods of all sizes. Wish I would have bought sooner it really opened up space and gives me the peace of mind that my poles are in a secure location instead of leaning against the wall. I would recommend getting one if you are thinking about purchasing one!
customer_reviews.author: Nic S

customer_reviews.title: 4 WHEELS SHORT OF 5 STARS
customer_reviews.text: I thought, or assumed it had wheels. Why wouldn’t it? That way you could put it in a corner and wheel it out as needed. I’ll definitely be adding them. As far as the product, just how it comes, it’s okay. Lucky to get 12 of my big trolling combos on the 24 rod rack but I expected that. It went together tool free and in under 5 minutes. The package is incredibly small and lightweight which was nice. I will get some use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had thought of this
customer_reviews.text: Took five minutes to assemble and it 'works good, lasts a long time' as an old acquaintance from Arkansas would say. Exactly as advertised. Already reordered a second unit. One suggestion - add a little more friction to the end caps. They slip off too easily. Has the manufacturer thought about some kind of fasteners or 'tighter' fit? Not complaining - deserves five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mike V.

customer_reviews.title: First time KK customer.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first KastKing product and I've always been skeptical of them due to the known paid or incentive-based reviews. I truly give this item a 5 star. It is sturdy and durable. It is aesthetically pleasing to the eye. Easy to assemble. Doesn't break the bank. Don't have rods all over the basement now. Can't ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: THE ANSWER TO CLUTTER AND WIFE RAGE!
customer_reviews.text: Look no further. Every know and again you realize there is a momentary answer to wife-anger, and this is one of those moments. No longer will your “stuff” be spread throughout the designated room for housing your obsessions. It’s light weight, sturdy, easy to assemble and works perfectly for a low and reasonable price!!! I am going to buy another one now...
customer_reviews.author: Erik Nuveen

customer_reviews.title: Well made unit. Sturdy once loaded. Works with all size and length rods and reels.
customer_reviews.text: Some rods do not fit as well as other but overall most fit on there with no problem. I was able to fit all my rods and reels for salt water and freshwater on the rack. My kids rods fit on there also with no problem. Highly recommended. Received one broken part but called the company with the amazon order number and received a replacement quickly.
customer_reviews.author: WLC101

customer_reviews.title: Great Fishing Accessory
customer_reviews.text: The picture shows 16 rods and reels of various sizes from my smallest spinning reel up to two 50 wide trolling rigs. You could store several more reel and rods if they were smaller than in the picture. It was easy to set up, very sturdy, and saves a massive amount of space given how awkward rods are to store. It doesn’t take up much room so it is also a nice display...I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Sheffield

customer_reviews.title: easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I almost didn't buy this because another review talked about hard assemble, not my experience. The assemble was easy, no tools needed, it's all snap together, took about 5mins. Yes it's a bit small but I only use every other slot and it works great that way, you can't beat the price so I might buy another if I run out of room.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Rod and reel Holder
customer_reviews.text: Boy it for a surprise for my hubby and he loved it! Very sturdy, very good quality and holds all of his fresh on salt water rods and reels. Will probably buy another for his offshore rigs. So nice having them organized. Very happy with this product the best we’ve ever tried.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 13 rods
customer_reviews.text: This rack is small but holds 13 rods in a neat and orderly way. I think its a little pricey for what it is but it works and takes up very little room and does look nice. Easy to put together except it must be taken apart to put on the handle so make sure you do that initially...I opted for not using the handle. Our poles are all regular sized bass, catfish and crappie poles so nothing oversized at all.
customer_reviews.author: lisa paris

customer_reviews.title: Small footprint and great product
customer_reviews.text: Wow!! My husband had rods lined up on every wall in our office. We purchased 2 of these racks and have not been disappointed! These rod racks have a small footprint and hold tons of rods without touching each other! Now of I could only get him to move everything to the garage!! I would definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Plastic corner broke while putting it together
customer_reviews.text: I would of gave this 5 stars but 1 of the plastic corners cracked as I was putting it together. I’m hoping kastking will replace the piece that broke. Other then that it’s a great rod rack. Update. Kastking sent me out the new piece that I broke when I was putting it together I want to thank kastking and change my rating to 5 stars. Update. Kastking sent me out the piece I broke with no questions asked. I changed my rating to 5 stars. Great rod rack!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You may think its too small, but it really works.  Cleaned up my fishing rod area.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions do not cover everything you need to assemble, but its easy enough to figure out. When assembled, I thought this is way too small; but then I started loading my fishing rods and it worked. Even my surf casting rods fit. Great little unit. Takes up less room than my homemade version and allowed me to free up some much needed space. Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Drake

customer_reviews.title: At last....a multiple rod holder that works.
customer_reviews.text: This item works exactly as advertised. product is very well made, holds my fishing rods solidly with no wobble or fear of toppling over. Easy to assemble....Instructions were pretty good...it only took a few minutes to put together. no tools were needed..... I am happy to see that this was American Made....and truly great quality..... Thanks for a great product......I was not paid or received a free sample or a promise for expressing my thoughts. Great product, buy one.....no more rods bunched up in a corner all stuck together like pick up sticks.
customer_reviews.author: arthur g

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 24 rod rack from Kastking!
customer_reviews.text: Another awesome kastking product. This 24 rod rack was a perfect size. Light weight. Sturdy and durable. Very easy to install out of the box no tools needed. Would I recommend it? Yes! Don’t hesitate seriously if your into fish and need a rod rack this one is it. I know there’s other companies that are cheaper but you get what you pay for buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: John A.

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Item as promised.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. (Just be sure the upright post grooves are facing each other). Right now have 16 rods with reels and 4 rods only. I was able to alternate reels facing in and out and have few reels on rods at different heights which helps. Before all were leaned up in a corner of a room. Holding more rod reel combos than I thought it would. Exceeds my expectations. Great rod reel organizer.
customer_reviews.author: bigbobsr6000

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but doesn't work as shown
customer_reviews.text: The rack is OK. The problem is it falls apart easy if moved and you CANNOT fill it full with rods and reels. The reels if put side by side cause an issue. They will not fit. You still must have a space or road only in between two to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Scott W Yonce

customer_reviews.title: Holds my rods.
customer_reviews.text: Read the description! This is very small it holding my rods but i would not purchase again as it is also lightweight and can easily tip. Nothing wrong with product whatsoever I just want something bigger and sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Strong enough aluminum. Very easy assembly. Doesn’t hold 24 rods with big reels. Some of my rod and reels will fit side by side but many take up two slots. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Clohse

customer_reviews.title: Would not purchase again
customer_reviews.text: After it was assembled it looked nice. But it was not easily put together. The screw that’s is supposed to slide does not easily slide. It is very light weight and not something I felt worth the cost. I would have expected heavier material for the price. Not expecting it to last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: When I unpacked it thought it was a cheap rack that would not hold anything. Kept an open mind set it up and stored everything from a 16 ft fly rod to 4 ft spinning rod and it held all the poles great. Right price, right size, and the right choice for me.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hockings

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rod holder!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding design, easy to assemble, holds lots of rods of different sizes (big offshore to ultra light spinning) and is stable. Also, easy to remove rods without hitting 8' ceilings, as the rods pull out, rather than lift up. Far superior to any carousel holder I have used. Also, better than any holder using clips, which don't work for big or small diameter rods.
customer_reviews.author: knkrestoration

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly after watching Utube video.
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly after watching the Utube video. But I got the 12 rod holder and it has a handle on it. Written instructions don't reference it. However, if you've ever played w/erector sets or lego toys you can figure it out. (Although I do have 4 pieces left over :-)) Nonetheless it works as promised and I even have it holding one surf rod.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Malin

customer_reviews.title: Great Display and Rod Holder
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. If you have large rods, the handles will get in the way. Notice in the picture the reels are staggered by height. If they're the same height, they'll not fit properly - thats ok, you just don't get as many rods in the holder.
customer_reviews.author: Apollo

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, easy to assemble, functional - but only 24 rods if at least some don't have reels on them.
customer_reviews.text: Easily assembled with my 12-year old grandson, this rack was a great addition to the garage for storing fishing rods. You won't necessarily be able to store 24 rods if they have reels mounted on them, depending on the size of the reels and what side of the each reel the retrieve is, but it is a good, lightweight solution to storing more rods than our original wooden rack can accommodate.
customer_reviews.author: Mirage

customer_reviews.title: Good but small defect
customer_reviews.text: Although I am extremely happy with the product, there was a minor defect that was discovered after the product was already assembled. One of the black pieces at the end of the long bottom shelf (the one with the kast king logo) was not glued properly. I know I can submit it for a return but I would hate to take it apart and ship it back. As you can see from the attached pictures it was not glued properly. This made my stand look uneven. I tried to snap it back in place but the industrial glue would not budge. Other than that, the stand is good
customer_reviews.author: Alfonso

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stand, gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: Read all the reviews and was hesitant in buying it. Now I'm glad I took a gamble. Easy to assemble. Very sturdy. I read reviews stating that their rods would fall overnight. My rod/reel combos have been upright for 3 weeks now. Possibly user error for the people having that problem. I know that it can hold 24 sole rods but it cannot hold 24 rod and reel combos. I actually like my rod/reels spaced out anyways. Caps at the base are loose but nothing a little glue cant fix. Will buy another one in the future when I fill this one up.
customer_reviews.author: Yong ki Chon

customer_reviews.title: Holds Rods quite well but difficult to put together
customer_reviews.text: This rod holder was quite easy to understand and light but some of the pieces were troubling to put together hence quality of it. Overall i got it together in a timely matter and was happy with how light it is and how well it can hold the rods.
customer_reviews.author: bwong247

customer_reviews.title: great rod holder, but smaller then I expected
customer_reviews.text: I like the design very much but I think I should have ordered the larger rack. In fact, I thought I was ordering the larger one as the reviews I was reading were all of the larger rack. I suppose I did not pay close enough attention while ordering. Otherwise its a good rack.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. The top plastic caps slide off too easy and the bases do not physically attach to the stand, rather they slide into slots. Unless you move the stand frequently, use it for travel, or otherwise knock it over its very sturdy. No tools required so it’s easy to break down and move and it’s adjustable. I wish the space between the rods was a hair bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathon Martin

customer_reviews.title: Rods do not stay up in rack constantly fall over
customer_reviews.text: Can’t keep rods stable in this rack, nothing to hold them stable. Constantly fall over. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Fishing  pole rack
customer_reviews.text: Rack is great once you're able to get it together. I instructions are not the greatest and made this guy extremely frustrating. Once together looks great and hold fishing pole bo issues
customer_reviews.author: Bam

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant design
customer_reviews.text: I don't review often but the design is brilliant. It holds my offshore Penn rigs, near shore and inshore rigs nice and tights. I'm ordering three more to hold my other rods and fly rods. Only gripes: 1. Wish it had caster option, I'm going to the local HD to see what I can get. 2. Need a flat head screw driver for assembly to compress the peg fittings.
customer_reviews.author: Flybox

customer_reviews.title: Keeps all my rods organized and protected
customer_reviews.text: Keeps all my rods organized and protected. I use to just lean my rods in the corner, now with this rack they actually take up less room and protect them from scratches. I store all my offshore/inshore gear on this rack, for your larger sized reels you would need to skip 1 or 2 notches to fit them with the reel still attached to the rod.
customer_reviews.author: RHsu

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Pure and simple. Nothing fits together tightly. All lopsided. I had to use duct tape to hold the pile of junk together. Came with parts that don't even show in instructions where they go.
customer_reviews.author: Wilchbla

customer_reviews.title: This will last forever so we most likely will not buy it again for ourselves, however we will buy it for a present
customer_reviews.text: We live in the West Cost of Florida, Hernando area and fish both salt and fresh water. This Rack was very easy to put together and holds all of our different rods perfectly. Water or other abuse does not bother it; well made for us sportsmen who actually use the items we purchase. This looks like it will last forever so we most likely will not buy it again for ourselves, however we will buy it for a present for others.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick K.

customer_reviews.title: Fits less rods than stated.
customer_reviews.text: This rod rack is great but you can’t use all the notches. The reels take up too much space. It also has a slight wobble to it. But overall it’s not an awful rod rack.
customer_reviews.author: Keirstonmarie

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Keeps rods off floor and organized. With larger line counter reels you can’t utilize every spot but size it’s big there is enough room for at least 12 rods and big reels
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves it! Yes, it's easy to put together. I bought it for him and after a month of it still in the box, I decided I would give it a try. It was together and waiting for him when he got home from work.
customer_reviews.author: Bridgette Sessoms

customer_reviews.title: Made from good materials, aluminum
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, made from high quality aluminum, excellent fit and finish, seems quite stable enough. I have this outside and it looks like it will hold up well. It can hold 24 rods, but also kayak paddles. I have some very short children's rods which it also can hold. You can adjust this when assembling to fit the smaller/larger items as you need. I am replacing a wooden rack which rotted out after less than a year. I should have bought this one first.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Awesome rack
customer_reviews.text: Way better than the round style racks. Very sturdy and currently full of a variety of different sized rods. Bought this for a man who fishes way too much and his only complaint is that it only holds 24 rods.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: I love that it is freestanding and doesn’t gobble up wall ...
customer_reviews.text: The stand was a breeze to set up even though the instructions left some details to the imagination. I love that it is freestanding and doesn’t gobble up wall space. It holds plenty of poles and works well with variously sized poles.
customer_reviews.author: Somebody in MN

customer_reviews.title: Well made and holds a lot.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in July for my husband's birthday. He loves it. It has many spaces for his fishing poles and holds many different sizes. The only wish that I had for it is that it hung on the wall for more storage and less floor space use. The product is sturdy and holds the poles in place. Shipping was quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: tobias ocker

customer_reviews.title: Decent storage rack for fishing rods
customer_reviews.text: Easily holds 8-10 rods with reels; easy to put the rods in there. Once loaded, it's a little tippy. Also, the bottom flat pieces that the bases of the rods sit on, don't want to stay in place. Wish there was a better way to secure it. Overall, for the price, it does the job. Makes it easier to transport and store multiple rods.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Peters

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy, PITA to install. Won’t fit my rods. Falls apart every time I move it. Pure and utter crap. I would return it but it’s only $60 bucks and that ain’t worth my time. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy R. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: 24 rod holder that is very stable. It won't hold 24 rods with reels, rather +/- 18 freshwater or saltwater medium sized combos (4000 reels and smaller). My only complaint is the tolerances are not accurate enough on a few of the parts. I had to file two of the plastic inserts slightly down as they were simply too tight to fit. I applied too much force on the first piece and slightly bent the section. Regardless it is an excellent rod holder and I wouldn't hesitate to purchase another one despite this one drawback.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: Not as big as I thought it would be. It will hold 24 rods if you have no reel on them. But it does the job for me. I don't have 24 rods.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Creech

customer_reviews.title: Great rod holder
customer_reviews.text: Love this rod holder..only thing I had to do other then assemble is put some adhesive on the rails on the bottom and the caps. But it's very sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.author: christopher stonebraker

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Bother
customer_reviews.text: Although reading reviews I guess was good at one time, do not bother. The plastic pieces are cut in tolerance too large for metal, so they will literally fall off if moved unless you glue everything together. Was returned twice. Same. The 24 unit model, unlike 12, has no handles so you likely have to remove all of the rods to move.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Not With it
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely not worth the money. Directions are terrible and it will not even hold 6 poles with rods well. Not as sturdy as it looked. Very dissappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will fit12 to 18 rod and reel combos depending on size
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rod holder, sturdy and easy to put together. It only took 20 minutes to put (2) of them together, while drinking a cup of coffee. My rod and reel combos store neatly along my wall and look clean while out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Highplainsman

customer_reviews.title: First rod holder that I liked.
customer_reviews.text: A really well designed rod holder except once you have it filled it with rods don't try to pick it up and move it unless you have duct taped the legs together. If you don't, the legs will pull out of the base and chaos rules.
customer_reviews.author: HST Southern MD

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Product is well built. My only complaint is there isn't enough space between reels to fit all baitcast reels without giving up a space or 2. I run small baitcast reels such as a shimano core 50e mg and shimano chronarch 50e....all tiny, but still needed to give up a rod space to fit side by side. Other then that, I do like the stand and it looks great too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pricy but works
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to put together with no tools needed and it does it job holds my rods and doesn’t allow them to learn to fall off the rack holder I would recommend if you can get pass the price tag
customer_reviews.author: TWiiiGGY

customer_reviews.title: Bravo Kastking!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical. Thru bass pro and cabelas, no one had a solid rod and pole holder that was ridged enough for cost. This unit is awesome! Solid, portable, and fits my surf rods as well as inshore and bass poles. Very good product, thank you!
customer_reviews.author: J3=

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Our son is a tournament bass fisherman and it holds rods way better than other racks out there. The design makes it easy to put in without having to squeeze the rod into a clip. It holds a lot of rods with reels—a big deal. We are fortunate to have options, and chose this and happily paid for it. Really impressed with the quality. Assembly was in 10 mins. Great packaging even. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: James H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality - Well made.
customer_reviews.text: Very good value! Well constructed and sturdy. I purchased long-stem (1-1/2”) 2” casters from Tractor Supply, drilled holes in the bases, and now the rack is very mobile in my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Banker2

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a fisherman!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a Father’s Day gift for my husband. He absolutely loves it and got his fishing rods on there that day. I assembled this very easily in no time. As another reviewer mentioned, it won’t hold 24, but ours has 11 on there with a space between the rods so they don’t touch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: A little skeptical upon unboxing because it was a little ‘cheap’ looking. However once assembled it’s sturdy and looks great! Will probably be purchasing a second one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Buckingham

customer_reviews.title: Must of changed builders
customer_reviews.text: I bought four of these months ago, and served their purpose well. Though cheap, they filled the job. Even had one set up to handle 4 50's and 4 30's. I ordered two more and what i got was junk. Machining is a joke, I suffered through almost an hour trying to get the slotted screw into position on the sides, and had to eventually break out a hammer. So off were the tolerances that it is unusable. Will not be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wrong parts
customer_reviews.text: Had to modify to make it work rather than wait for another one and return this one. I like the product but for larger rod and reel combos you need to skip a slot or two to make them fit. Wish I would have bought 2 but I'm afraid the other one will come with the wrong parts attached again. This was so aggravating as I put it together Christmas morning.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth L. Hendon Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: What a complete piece of trash. The bolt that is supposed to slide down doesnt even fit. The entire thing is held together by nothing. Nothing about this pile of trash works. Don't waste your money or time with this.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Croskrey

customer_reviews.title: great product , easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit, I do not like to assemble items.. But must say, the directions that came with the item were easy to follow and the assembly was simple ( no tools needed) . the item is portable , and holds rods very well and kayak paddles. well worth the money!!.
customer_reviews.author: Madigan's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Robust!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rod rack to hold my larger saltwater rods. It is very well made and assembly was very easy. There are some designs that make putting it together almost foolproof. Would buy again and recommend to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: barry blackburn

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design
customer_reviews.text: If there were zero stars I would give it a zero. I could almost ignore how difficult it was to put together but it fails in all aspects. I couldn’t even get 2 6’ spinning rods to balance on it. If you even breath on it over the rods go to the ground. It is constructed such that the rods balance vertically. Anything that shifts the balance causes the rods to all come down. Sending back ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Heye Jr

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: If in doubt which size to get, size up! I went with the smaller model and it is a lot smaller than what the pictures show.
customer_reviews.author: Hoang

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were a bit lacking and getting the set screws for the sliding racks to move was challenging to say the least. It was a pain to assemble but this was really due to very tight tolerances in the two set screw channels. Overall it looks like it’s going to work just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Edward W. Landgrover

customer_reviews.title: I would like to revise my review based on their excellent customer ...
customer_reviews.text: I would like to revise my review based on their excellent customer service. I spoke to Rosalind, she helped me out tremendously. Although, the experience was not ideal, she was able to listen and resolve this matter for me. The product itself is what it describes. Not bad for the price too.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great fishing rod rack
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and easy to assemble. I've tried several other racks and this is the best by far. It holds saltwater and freshwater poles. I even use it to store my painting roller extension poles.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for rod storage
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, sturdy, holds lots of rods, saves space. No more rods in the corner leaning against each other. I have lots of salt water rods and reels. Handles everything.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Perfect for my rids. This thing looks like it will last for a very long time. Great job KastKing!!
customer_reviews.author: Abe Frohman

customer_reviews.title: Amazed!!
customer_reviews.text: The KastKing fishing rod holder is the best and most useful item I have purchased in a while!! I am truly amazed on how easy it was to assemble. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Barry

customer_reviews.title: Very easy assembly and doesn't take up a lot of space
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a gift for my husband and he loves it. Very easy assembly and doesn't take up a lot of space. Sturdy but lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary D. Young

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad rod rack!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to put together and just add some gorilla glue to the bottom caps and you have a great rod rack and not gonna break your wallet. very light weight but feels sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Mortensen

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: My son is an avid fisherman and we were going nuts with all his poles all over the garage. We purchased this stand for organizing his poles. BEST buy ever. It's sturdy and well made. It's perfect to hold multiple rods. Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Boys

customer_reviews.title: Solid product holds lots of rods
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, holds lots of rods securely. Exactly what I wanted and fits the bill nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Don Beahm

customer_reviews.title: Great rack!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Better than expected. Seen a review on tackletour.com and decided to pull the trigger. Glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Basham

product_meta.title: KastKing Fishing Rod Rack – Perfect Fishing Rod Holder - Holds Up to 24 Rods - 24 Rod Rack for All Types of Fishing Rods and Combos/ 12 Rod Rack for Freshwater Rods - ICAST Award Winner
product_meta.description:
Super light and non-rusting aluminum frame
Easy assembly, no tools needed, portable for convenient use
Patent pending design 

KastKing Fishing Rod Holders return your fishing poles to the full upright position after a day of fishing. 
Its rust-resistant frame is made from high quality aluminum. 
Cushioned rod holders protect your rod handle and lock it firmly in place. 
Easy assembly, light weight, and a carrying handle make the KastKing Rod Holder totally portable.
24 rod rack will accommodate larger saltwater rods with handles up to 1 ¾ diameter. The 12 rod fold flat rod rack has 1 1/8 inch (28.5 mm) diameter openings and will work with rod handles up to 1 inch (25 mm) in diameter, such as most bass fishing rods, trout fishing rods, and fly fishing rods and combos. 12 rod fold flat rack is not recommended for fishing rods or combos with handles more than 1 1/16 inch in diameter or heavier saltwater fishing rod combos. The largest model holds 24 rods. 
The patent pending KastKing Rod Racks are also light weight: 
12-Rod Rack: 3LB 
24-Rod Rack: 4.8LB 
Fold Flat Rod Rack 12 rod: 2LB 

This one of a kind fishing rod rack holds all brands of fishing rods such as KastKing Phantom Kayak rods, KastKing Perigee rods, Ugly Stick rods, St. Croix rods, G. Loomis rods, and others. Get one for your garage, cabin, or maybe even the bedroom. Have your rods at the ready when it’s time to go fishing! 
Dimensions: 
Dimension (Height×Width×Depth): 
12 Rods: 15.5"×17"×12" 
12 Rod Racks will fit in any nook or cranny and only uses 189.75 square inches (1.32 sq. ft.) of floor space 
24 Rods: 28.5"×29"×13" 
24 Rod Racks only uses 363.375 square inches (2.52 sq. ft.) of floor space 
12-Foldable rack fits fishing poles with handles up to one inch in diameter 14"x16.5"x7.25"
feature_bullets: STURDY QUALITY and light-weight aluminum fishing rack that's easy to assemble and occupies minimal floor space.

PROTECTS and ORGANIZES a rod collection of up to 24 fishing rods. 24 rod rack is great for any type of fishing pole. The 12 rod rack is suitable for smaller diameter rods such as freshwater bass rods.
ADEQUATE spacing allowing for your rods not to overlap each other while storing them in the same vicinity.
AWARD WINNER – ICAST Award winning design. Whether in your bedroom or garage, or as a rod holder for boats, a KastKing rod rack is great for protecting and organizing your fishing rod collection.
EASY ASSEMBLY without frustration when putting it together. No tools required. Great gift for all the fishermen!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
